eras.name: Triassic Period
eras.description: The Triassic was when dinosaurs first appeared! The world was just recovering from a huge disaster, and life was starting over.
eras.climate: Hot and dry, like a giant desert
eras.temperature: Very warm â€” no ice at the poles!
eras.continents: All the land was stuck together in one GIANT supercontinent called Pangaea (pan-JEE-uh). You could walk from one side of the world to the other!
eras.ocean: One massive ocean called Panthalassa surrounded all the land
plants: Cycads (plants that look like palm trees)
No flowers yet â€” flowers hadn't been invented!
animals: Lots of reptiles that looked like crocodiles
Early mammals (tiny and furry, like shrews)
coolFacts: The Triassic started after the worst extinction event ever â€” 96% of ocean life died out!
The first dinosaurs were small â€” only about the size of dogs!
It was SO hot that the middle of Pangaea was like a giant desert where almost nothing could live!
There were no polar ice caps â€” even the North and South Poles were warm!
The first mammals appeared, but they were tiny and lived in the shadows of bigger reptiles!
eras.endEvent: The Triassic ended with volcanic eruptions that split Pangaea apart and killed off many species, making room for dinosaurs to take over!

eras.name: Jurassic Period
eras.description: The Jurassic was the golden age of dinosaurs! This is when dinosaurs got HUGE and ruled the world!
eras.climate: Warm and humid, like a giant rainforest
eras.temperature: Warm and wet â€” perfect for growing plants and dinosaurs!
eras.continents: Pangaea was breaking apart! North America and Africa started drifting away from each other.
eras.ocean: The Atlantic Ocean was just being born as continents split apart
plants: Lots of moss and wet, swampy plants
animals: First birds appeared (evolved from small dinosaurs!)
In the ocean: huge plesiosaurs and ichthyosaurs
coolFacts: This is when dinosaurs got HUGE â€” the biggest land animals ever walked the Earth!
The first birds appeared during the Jurassic â€” they evolved from small feathered dinosaurs!
Sea levels were super high, creating shallow tropical seas everywhere!
The world was so warm and wet that there were forests near the North and South Poles!
Archaeopteryx, the famous 'first bird,' lived during this time â€” it had feathers AND teeth!
eras.endEvent: The Jurassic ended with changes in sea levels and climate, but dinosaurs kept thriving into the next period!

eras.name: Cretaceous Period
eras.description: The Cretaceous was the last and longest age of dinosaurs! This is when T-Rex and Triceratops lived â€” and when flowers first appeared!
eras.climate: Warm with seasons â€” some areas had hot summers and mild winters
eras.temperature: Still very warm, but cooling down slowly over millions of years
eras.continents: The continents were getting closer to where they are today! The Atlantic Ocean was getting wider.
eras.ocean: Warm shallow seas covered large parts of the continents
plants: FLOWERS appeared for the first time!
animals: T-Rex â€” the king of predators!
In the ocean: mosasaurs (giant swimming lizards)
coolFacts: The first flowers bloomed during the Cretaceous â€” before this, there were NO flowers on Earth!
This is when many of the most famous dinosaurs lived â€” including T-Rex!
Ants and bees appeared because flowers needed them for pollination!
Some areas of North America were covered by a shallow sea right down the middle!
The largest flying animal ever lived in the Cretaceous â€” Quetzalcoatlus had a wingspan as wide as a small plane!
eras.endEvent: A giant asteroid hit Earth 66 million years ago, causing tsunamis, earthquakes, and blocking out the sun. This killed all the dinosaurs (except birds) and ended the Age of Dinosaurs!

mesozoicEra.name: Mesozoic Era (The Age of Dinosaurs)
mesozoicEra.description: The Mesozoic Era is the whole time when dinosaurs ruled the Earth! It's divided into three periods: Triassic, Jurassic, and Cretaceous.
mesozoicEra.bigIdea: Dinosaurs lived for 186 MILLION years â€” that's way longer than humans have been around (only about 300,000 years)!

comparisonFacts: If you made a timeline where one year equals one million years, dinosaurs would rule for 186 years, but humans would only show up in the last few months!
T-Rex lived closer to YOUR time than to Stegosaurus' time! (T-Rex: 66 million years ago, Stegosaurus: 150 million years ago)
The Mesozoic Era lasted 3 times longer than the age of mammals has lasted so far!
More time passed between Stegosaurus and T-Rex than between T-Rex and YOU!
